name: Abydos
shortDescription: Sacred city and cult center of Osiris, most holy pilgrimage site in ancient Egypt

name: Aegis
shortDescription: Divine shield bearing Medusa's head, wielded by Zeus and Athena to inspire terror and protection

name: Aesir
shortDescription: The warrior gods of Asgard - the principal tribe of Norse deities who rule the cosmos with sovereignty, law, and martial might.

name: Akh
shortDescription: Egyptian transfigured spirit, the perfected immortal form achieved through successful resurrection

name: Ama-no-Iwato (Heavenly Rock Cave)
shortDescription: The cave where Amaterasu hid herself, plunging the world into darkness until the kami lured her out

name: Ambrosia
shortDescription: Divine food of the Olympian gods, conferring immortality, healing, and preservation from decay

name: Ankh
shortDescription: Ancient Egyptian symbol of life, eternal existence, and divine power

name: Arete
shortDescription: Excellence and virtue in fulfilling one's purpose, the highest human aspiration uniting skill, courage, and moral goodness

name: Ark of the Covenant
shortDescription: Sacred gold-covered chest containing the Tablets of the Law, the holiest object in ancient Israel

name: Asgard
shortDescription: The celestial realm of the Aesir gods, connected to Midgard by the rainbow bridge Bifrost

name: Ash Tree
shortDescription: Sacred tree species of Yggdrasil, the World Tree, from which the first man was created and symbolizing cosmic connection

name: Avalon
shortDescription: Mystical island paradise, the Apple Isle where King Arthur was taken to heal from mortal wounds

name: Ba
shortDescription: Egyptian soul or personality, the unique individual essence that travels freely after death

name: Bifrost
shortDescription: The rainbow bridge connecting Midgard to Asgard, guarded by Heimdall and destined to shatter at Ragnar√∂k

name: Bilva
shortDescription: Sacred wood apple tree whose trifoliate leaves are essential in Shiva worship

name: Blot
shortDescription: Norse sacrificial ritual offering blood and meat to the gods and spirits to secure favor, prosperity, and divine protection

name: Brahma
shortDescription: The creator god of the Hindu Trimurti, who brings forth the universe from the cosmic waters

name: Br√≠singamen
shortDescription: Freyja's legendary necklace of unparalleled beauty, forged by four dwarves and symbol of fertility, beauty, and desire

name: Burning Bush
shortDescription: Sacred site where God appeared to Moses in a bush that burned but was not consumed, revealing His name YHWH

name: Caduceus
shortDescription: Herald's staff of Hermes entwined with two serpents, symbol of commerce, negotiation, and divine mediation

name: Cauldron of the Dagda
shortDescription: Inexhaustible cauldron of abundance that never empties and from which no one leaves unsatisfied

name: Chimera
shortDescription: Fire-breathing hybrid monster with a lion's head, goat's body rising from its back, and serpent's tail

name: Cinnabar
shortDescription: Sacred red mineral central to Daoist alchemy and immortality practices

name: Claimoh Solais
shortDescription: Sword of Light that shines with the brilliance of the sun and ensures victory in battle

name: Crete
shortDescription: Sacred island where Zeus was born and raised in secret, home to the Minotaur and Minoan civilization

name: Crook and Flail
shortDescription: Royal regalia of pharaohs and Osiris, symbolizing kingship, justice, and divine authority

name: Delphi
shortDescription: Sacred oracle site of Apollo, center of the ancient world, where the Pythia delivered prophecies

name: Dharma
shortDescription: Cosmic law, righteousness, duty, and moral order that sustains the universe

name: Dionysian Rites
shortDescription: Ecstatic worship ceremonies of Dionysus featuring wine, music, dance, and trance states seeking divine possession and liberation

name: Diwali
shortDescription: Hindu Festival of Lights celebrating the victory of light over darkness, good over evil, and knowledge over ignorance through five days of ritual, celebration, and illumination

name: Diyu
shortDescription: Chinese underworld of judgment and punishment, ruled by Yanluo Wang and the Ten Kings of Hell

name: Djed Pillar
shortDescription: Sacred pillar symbolizing stability, endurance, and the backbone of Osiris

name: Dodona
shortDescription: Ancient oracle of Zeus in Epirus where priestesses interpreted divine will through rustling oak leaves

name: Dragon Palace
shortDescription: Magnificent underwater palace of the Dragon Kings, repository of cosmic treasures

name: Dragon Pearl
shortDescription: Luminous orb of concentrated cosmic power held by dragons, symbolizing wisdom and divine authority

name: Draupnir
shortDescription: Odin's magical golden ring that creates eight identical rings every ninth night, symbolizing endless wealth and abundance

name: Druidry
shortDescription: Ancient Celtic spiritual tradition of priests, judges, and wisdom-keepers who mediated between human and divine

name: Duat
shortDescription: Egyptian underworld, realm of the dead ruled by Osiris, where souls journey and face judgment

name: Elder
shortDescription: Sacred tree associated with the goddess Freyja, protection magic, and the boundary between worlds

name: Eleusinian Mysteries
shortDescription: Secret initiation rites held annually at Eleusis, promising initiates a blessed afterlife through the mysteries of Demeter and Persephone

name: Elixir of Life
shortDescription: Alchemical potion granting immortality through Daoist transformation practices

name: Elysium
shortDescription: Paradise within the Underworld where heroes and the righteous enjoy eternal bliss

name: Field of Reeds
shortDescription: Egyptian paradise, the blessed afterlife where the worthy dead live eternally in peace and abundance

name: F√≠or-Feis
shortDescription: Sacred marriage ritual between king and land goddess, essential for legitimate sovereignty

name: Frankincense
shortDescription: Sacred aromatic resin used in Temple incense, representing purity and divine presence

name: Gae Bulg
shortDescription: Legendary barbed spear of Cu Chulainn that creates thirty barbs upon entering the body

name: Gandiva
shortDescription: Arjuna's celestial bow created by Brahma, known for its thunderous sound and unfailing accuracy

name: Garuda
shortDescription: Divine eagle-man, king of birds and mount of Vishnu, sworn enemy of serpents

name: Geis
shortDescription: Sacred obligation or taboo that binds individuals through supernatural force, whose violation brings disaster

name: Ginseng
shortDescription: Sacred medicinal root believed to contain concentrated qi and promote longevity

name: Giza Pyramid Complex
shortDescription: Legendary pyramid complex housing the Great Pyramid, Sphinx, and royal tombs of the Fourth Dynasty

name: Gjallarhorn
shortDescription: Heimdall's mighty horn whose blast can be heard throughout all Nine Realms, to be sounded at the onset of Ragnar√∂k

name: Gleipnir
shortDescription: Magical binding created by dwarves to restrain Fenrir, woven from six impossible things and appearing as soft as silk

name: Golden Fleece
shortDescription: Magical golden fleece from the flying ram Chrysomallos, object of Jason's quest and symbol of authority and kingship

name: Greek Sacrificial Offerings
shortDescription: Traditional Greek religious practice of offering animals, food, and goods to gods as acts of worship, supplication, and thanksgiving

name: Gungnir
shortDescription: Odin's legendary spear that never misses its target and always returns to his hand after being thrown

name: Hamingja
shortDescription: Personal luck, power, and spiritual essence that can be accumulated, transferred, and inherited through family lines

name: Harae (Purification)
shortDescription: Ritual purification that removes kegare (impurity) and restores connection with kami

name: Hazel
shortDescription: Sacred tree of wisdom and inspiration, source of poetic knowledge and divine insight in Celtic tradition

name: Helheim
shortDescription: The realm of the dead ruled by Hel, where those who die of sickness or old age dwell

name: Heliopolis
shortDescription: Ancient Egyptian city of the sun god, center of solar theology and creation mythology

name: Helm of Darkness
shortDescription: Invisibility helmet forged by the Cyclopes for Hades, granting complete concealment from mortal and divine sight

name: Hill of Tara
shortDescription: Sacred hill and seat of the High Kings of Ireland, center of political and spiritual power

name: Hubris
shortDescription: Excessive pride or arrogance, especially toward the gods, leading to downfall through divine punishment (nemesis)

name: Ise Grand Shrine
shortDescription: Japan's most sacred Shinto shrine complex, dedicated to Amaterasu and housing the sacred mirror

name: Isfet
shortDescription: Egyptian concept of chaos, disorder, injustice, and cosmic imbalance - the opposite of Ma'at

name: Izumo Taisha
shortDescription: Ancient shrine dedicated to Okuninushi, where all kami gather in the tenth lunar month

name: Jade
shortDescription: Sacred stone embodying virtue, purity, and immortality in Chinese culture

name: Jade Emperor's Palace
shortDescription: Supreme celestial palace where the Jade Emperor rules the heavenly bureaucracy

name: J√∂tnar (Giants)
shortDescription: Primordial giants embodying chaotic natural forces, enemies and ancestors of the Norse gods

name: Jotunheim
shortDescription: The realm of the giants (Jotnar), a wild and chaotic land representing primordial forces opposing divine order

name: Ka
shortDescription: Egyptian life force, vital essence, and spiritual double that sustains existence

name: Kami (Divine Spirits)
shortDescription: Divine spirits or gods that inhabit all things, the central concept of Shinto religion

name: Karma
shortDescription: Law of cause and effect governing action and consequence across lifetimes

name: Karnak Temple Complex
shortDescription: Massive temple complex dedicated to Amun-Ra, largest religious structure in ancient Egypt

name: Kegare (Ritual Impurity)
shortDescription: Ritual impurity or pollution, particularly associated with death, disease, and bodily functions

name: Ketoret (Temple Incense)
shortDescription: Sacred eleven-ingredient incense blend offered twice daily in the Temple, representing unity and divine service

name: Ki (Qi) - Life Energy
shortDescription: The vital life energy or spiritual force that flows through all living things

name: Kleos
shortDescription: Heroic glory and renown won through great deeds, granting immortality through lasting fame

name: Kunlun Mountain
shortDescription: Sacred mountain paradise of immortals and home of Xi Wangmu, axis mundi of Chinese cosmology

name: Kurukshetra
shortDescription: Sacred battlefield where the Mahabharata war was fought and the Bhagavad Gita was spoken

name: Kusanagi-no-Tsurugi
shortDescription: Legendary grass-cutting sword, one of the Three Imperial Regalia of Japan

name: Laurel
shortDescription: Sacred bay tree of Apollo, symbol of victory, prophecy, poetic inspiration, and purification

name: Lernaean Hydra
shortDescription: Multi-headed serpent monster with regenerating heads, slain by Heracles as his second labor

name: Lia Fail
shortDescription: Stone of Destiny that roars when touched by the rightful High King of Ireland

name: Lotus
shortDescription: Sacred flower symbolizing creation, rebirth, and the sun's daily resurrection

name: Ma'at
shortDescription: Egyptian concept of truth, justice, cosmic order, and harmony - the foundation of civilization

name: Mag Mell
shortDescription: Pleasant Plain, a paradisal otherworld realm of eternal joy, feasting, and abundance

name: Makara
shortDescription: Aquatic creature with crocodile/elephant features, vahana of Varuna and Ganga, symbol of water and fertility

name: Maya
shortDescription: Cosmic illusion that veils the true nature of reality and creates the appearance of multiplicity

name: Mead
shortDescription: Sacred honey wine associated with poetic inspiration, divine intoxication, and the otherworld feast

name: Mead of Poetry
shortDescription: Divine mead granting the gift of poetry and wisdom, created from the blood of Kvasir and claimed by Odin through cunning

name: Medusa
shortDescription: One of the three Gorgon sisters with serpent hair whose gaze turns viewers to stone

name: Menorah
shortDescription: Seven-branched golden candelabrum that illuminated the Temple, symbol of divine light and eternal Israel

name: Midgard
shortDescription: The realm of humans, the Middle Earth, surrounded by ocean and connected to Asgard by the rainbow bridge Bifrost

name: M√≠misbrunnr (Mimir's Well)
shortDescription: The Well of Wisdom beneath Yggdrasil in Jotunheim, where Odin sacrificed his eye to drink and gain cosmic knowledge

name: Minotaur
shortDescription: Bull-headed man imprisoned in the Labyrinth of Crete, offspring of Pasipha√´ and the Cretan Bull

name: Mistletoe
shortDescription: Sacred parasitic plant considered the most holy by Druids, used in healing and protection rituals

name: Mjolnir
shortDescription: Thor's legendary hammer, symbol of protection and divine power, capable of leveling mountains and returning to its wielder

name: Moira
shortDescription: Fate or destiny as the inescapable portion allotted to each being, personified by the three Moirai (Fates)

name: Moksha
shortDescription: Liberation from the cycle of birth and death, the ultimate goal of human existence

name: Mount Fuji
shortDescription: Sacred mountain and highest peak in Japan, dwelling place of the kami Konohanasakuya-hime

name: Mount Kailash
shortDescription: Sacred mountain and eternal abode of Lord Shiva and Parvati, one of the holiest sites in Asia

name: Mount Meru
shortDescription: Sacred cosmic mountain at the center of the universe, axis mundi connecting heaven and earth

name: Mount Olympus
shortDescription: Home of the twelve Olympian gods, the highest mountain in Greece and throne of divine power

name: Mount Sinai
shortDescription: Sacred mountain where Moses received the Torah and Ten Commandments from God

name: Mount Tai
shortDescription: Most sacred of China's Five Great Mountains, site of imperial feng and shan sacrifices

name: Mugwort
shortDescription: Sacred herb of protection, prophetic dreams, and magical sight, used in seidr practices and shamanic journeying

name: Mummification
shortDescription: Sacred Egyptian ritual of preserving the dead through embalming and wrapping to ensure successful journey through the Duat and eternal life in the afterlife

name: Musubi (Creative Power)
shortDescription: The creative and connecting power of the kami, the force that binds all things in relationship

name: Myrrh
shortDescription: Bitter aromatic resin used in sacred anointing oil and incense, symbolizing sacrifice and mortality

name: Myrtle
shortDescription: Evergreen shrub sacred to Aphrodite, symbol of love, beauty, and immortality

name: Nagas
shortDescription: Serpent beings with human and snake features, guardians of treasures and waters, rulers of the underworld

name: Nectar
shortDescription: Divine drink of the Olympian gods, conferring immortality and supernatural vitality

name: Nemed
shortDescription: Sacred space or sanctuary, a consecrated area set apart from the profane world

name: Newgrange
shortDescription: Ancient passage tomb and sacred site, aligned with winter solstice, dwelling of the Dagda and Aengus

name: Nile River
shortDescription: Sacred river of Egypt, source of life and fertility, manifestation of divine providence

name: Oak
shortDescription: Most sacred tree to Druids and many Indo-European cultures, symbol of strength, endurance, and divine wisdom

name: Ogham
shortDescription: Ancient Celtic alphabet of 20-25 characters, each associated with a tree and mystical meanings

name: Olive
shortDescription: Sacred tree and gift of Athena to Athens, symbol of peace, wisdom, prosperity, and civilization

name: Olympic Games
shortDescription: Sacred Panhellenic athletic festival held every four years at Olympia to honor Zeus, combining religious ritual with athletic competition

name: Opet Festival
shortDescription: Annual Theban festival celebrating the sacred marriage of Amun and Mut, renewing the pharaoh's divine power and cosmic order

name: Orlog
shortDescription: The primal law and accumulated layers of past actions that shape fate and define the fundamental nature of existence

name: Papyrus
shortDescription: Sacred plant of Lower Egypt, used for writing, symbolizing life and resurrection

name: Patala
shortDescription: Lowest of seven underworlds, realm of nagas and asuras, more beautiful than heaven

name: Peach of Immortality
shortDescription: Divine fruit from Xi Wangmu's garden that grants immortality and cosmic longevity

name: Pegasus
shortDescription: Divine winged horse born from Medusa's blood, tamed by Bellerophon and later servant of Zeus

name: Penglai
shortDescription: Mystical island paradise of immortals floating in the eastern sea

name: Pomegranate
shortDescription: Sacred fruit of the underworld, symbol of death, rebirth, fertility, and marriage

name: Prana
shortDescription: Vital life force energy that animates all living beings and pervades the cosmos

name: Qi
shortDescription: Vital life energy that flows through all things, fundamental to Chinese philosophy and practice

name: Ragnar√∂k
shortDescription: The prophesied end of the world, a final battle between gods and giants resulting in cosmic destruction and renewal

name: Rice (Sacred Grain)
shortDescription: Sacred grain that sustains Japan, gift from the kami and central to Shinto worship

name: River Ganges
shortDescription: Most sacred river in Hinduism, personified as goddess Ganga, descended from heaven to purify souls

name: River Styx
shortDescription: Sacred river marking the boundary between the living world and Underworld, by which gods swear unbreakable oaths

name: Ruyi Jingu Bang
shortDescription: Sun Wukong's magical staff that can change size at will, weighing 17,550 pounds

name: Ryugu-jo (Dragon Palace)
shortDescription: Underwater palace of the dragon god Ryujin, realm of timeless beauty beneath the sea

name: Sakaki (Sacred Tree)
shortDescription: Sacred evergreen tree used in Shinto rituals, the tree that held the mirror and jewel to lure Amaterasu

name: Sake (Sacred Rice Wine)
shortDescription: Sacred rice wine offered to kami and consumed in Shinto rituals

name: Samsara
shortDescription: The endless cycle of birth, death, and rebirth driven by karma and desire

name: Sefirot
shortDescription: Ten divine emanations through which God interacts with creation, forming the Tree of Life

name: Seidr
shortDescription: Norse shamanic magic involving trance, prophecy, and manipulation of fate, taught by Freyja and practiced primarily by women

name: Shimenawa (Sacred Rope)
shortDescription: Sacred rope made from rice straw that marks the boundary between sacred and profane

name: Soma
shortDescription: Divine nectar of immortality consumed by gods and offered in Vedic rituals, granting vision and power

name: Sphinx (Egyptian)
shortDescription: Guardian creature with human head and lion body, protector of sacred spaces and symbol of royal power

name: Sphinx (Greek)
shortDescription: Winged monster with woman's head and lion's body who posed deadly riddles to travelers at Thebes

name: Staff of Moses
shortDescription: Divine rod wielded by Moses to perform miracles and lead the Israelites out of Egypt

name: Stymphalian Birds
shortDescription: Man-eating birds with bronze beaks and metallic feathers that could be launched as deadly projectiles

name: Sudarshana Chakra
shortDescription: Vishnu's divine discus weapon with 108 serrated edges, representing cosmic order and time

name: Sva√∞ilfari
shortDescription: Supernaturally strong stallion who helped build Asgard's walls, father of Sleipnir through union with Loki

name: Swarga
shortDescription: Indra's celestial paradise where righteous souls enjoy temporary heavenly rewards before rebirth

name: Tablets of the Law
shortDescription: Two stone tablets inscribed with the Ten Commandments by the finger of God, given to Moses at Mount Sinai

name: Takamagahara (Plain of High Heaven)
shortDescription: The Plain of High Heaven, celestial realm where the kami dwell and where creation began

name: Tao
shortDescription: The Way - the ineffable source and principle underlying all existence in Daoist philosophy

name: Tartarus
shortDescription: Deepest abyss of the Underworld, prison for Titans and the wickedest souls

name: Tech Duinn
shortDescription: House of Donn, the gathering place of the dead before they journey to the otherworld

name: The Otherworld
shortDescription: Parallel realm of gods, spirits, and the dead, accessible through sidhe mounds, caves, and over water

name: Thebes
shortDescription: Ancient Egyptian religious capital, city of Amun, site of Karnak and Luxor temples

name: Thunderbolt of Zeus
shortDescription: Lightning weapon forged by the Cyclopes, Zeus's primary instrument of divine judgment and cosmic power

name: T√≠r na n√ìg
shortDescription: Land of eternal youth and beauty, a blessed otherworld realm beyond the western sea

name: Torii (Sacred Gate)
shortDescription: Sacred gateway marking the entrance to Shinto shrines and the transition from mundane to sacred space

name: Trident of Poseidon
shortDescription: Three-pronged spear forged by the Cyclopes, Poseidon's weapon to command seas, earthquakes, and storms

name: Trishula
shortDescription: Shiva's three-pronged trident representing creation, preservation, and destruction

name: Tulsi
shortDescription: Holy basil plant sacred to Vishnu, representing devotion and considered a manifestation of Lakshmi

name: Underworld
shortDescription: Realm of the dead ruled by Hades and Persephone, where souls journey after death

name: Vaikuntha
shortDescription: Eternal celestial realm of Lord Vishnu, a paradise beyond the material universe

name: Vajra
shortDescription: Indra's thunderbolt weapon, an indestructible divine weapon symbolizing both destruction and enlightenment

name: Valhalla
shortDescription: Odin's magnificent hall in Asgard where einherjar (chosen slain warriors) feast and train for Ragnar√∂k

name: Varanasi
shortDescription: Holiest city in Hinduism, eternal city of Shiva where death brings instant liberation

name: Was Scepter
shortDescription: Divine staff symbolizing power, dominion, and the authority of gods and pharaohs

name: Wu Xing
shortDescription: Five Elements theory - the cyclical system of Wood, Fire, Earth, Metal, and Water

name: Wyrd (Fate)
shortDescription: The Norse concept of fate and destiny, woven by the Norns and unavoidable even by the gods

name: Xenia
shortDescription: Sacred law of hospitality governing relations between hosts and guests, protected by Zeus Xenios

name: Xian
shortDescription: Daoist immortality - spiritual transcendence achieved through cultivation and alchemy

name: Yarrow
shortDescription: Sacred healing herb used for wound treatment, divination, protection, and invoking courage in battle

name: Yasakani no Magatama
shortDescription: Sacred curved jewel representing benevolence, one of the Three Imperial Regalia of Japan

name: Yata no Kagami
shortDescription: Sacred mirror that lured Amaterasu from her cave, one of the Three Imperial Regalia of Japan

name: Yellow River
shortDescription: Sacred river, cradle of Chinese civilization, and cosmic waterway guarded by river deities

name: Yew
shortDescription: Sacred evergreen tree associated with death, rebirth, and the runes, used for divination and magical purposes

name: Yggdrasil
shortDescription: The World Tree, an immense ash tree connecting the Nine Realms and serving as the cosmic axis of Norse mythology

name: Yin and Yang
shortDescription: Fundamental duality of complementary opposites that constitute all existence

name: Yomi (Underworld)
shortDescription: The underworld realm of the dead, a dark and polluted land of decay ruled by Izanami
